page.title: 02WANSFORD VILLAGE
page.content: Wansford is a quiet and beautiful village about half a mile long. It is based around its main street and spreads over the bridge. Terraced cottages built from stone dominate this road. In Wansford there are two pubs and one large hotel. The names of the pubs are THE PAPERMILLS and THE CROSS KEYS. The hotel is called THE HAYCOCK. For such a small village this is unusual and suggests that visitors from the surrounding area and from off the A1 use it. There is a post Office and two antique shops selling a number of old and valuable items. There is a church in Wansford and a Methodist Chapel. There is a butchers shop on the corner of some houses. There are between 100 and 150 houses in Wansford.
